The Confederate flag debate

Author: Alison Butkowski

Major U.S... retailers usually try to stay out of hot button social issues for fear of losing customers. However, pressure to remove confederate flags and confederate flag themed merchandise increased after a mass shooting of 9 black Charleston church goers showed the killer posing with the flag. Walmart, Sears, and eBay were some of the first companies to stop sales, with Amazon giving in shortly thereafter.

politics
us

2016: Year of the Snapchat Election

Author: Alison Butkowski

Snapchat isn’t the first company that comes to most people’s minds when it comes to getting kids interested in politics. However, the popular app is hoping to do just that in the 2016 U.S.. election. Leveraging their popularity amongst younger voters, they want to encourage users to share pictures and content from debates, rallies, and appearances to the Our Story feature which debuted in 2014.This feature allows users to share snaps from an event for all users to view.

us

Du Pont Heir/Child Rapist Would Not "Fare Well" in Prison

Author: Nufios Staff

Robert Richards IV, heir to the Du Pont fortune was given eight years probation and a recommendation that he seek help, after pleading guilty to sexual misconduct charges with his three year old daughter.

The judge who handed down the sentence claimed that Richards, "would not fare well" in the prison system.

Richards was able to get a plea deal that carried no jail time.

us
politics

House of Cards Threatened by Maryland in Move That Seems like TV

Author: Nufios Staff

In a move that would impress Frank Underwood, the Maryland House of Delegates has threatened to use eminent domain to keep the show from leaving to film in another state. The bill was proposed by Del. C. William Frick, who said that Media Rights Capital, the producer of House of Cards, had gone too far.

MRC sent a threatening letter to the governor of Maryland in January 2014, demanding more tax credits.

us
politics
movies & tv
culture
  • Read more about House of Cards Threatened by Maryland in Move That Seems like TV
  • Log in to post comments

U.S. Attorney General at Odds with Governor of Michigan Over Same Sex Marriage

Author: Nufios Staff

U.S. Attorney General Eric Holder extended Federal recognition to same sex couples married in Michigan this past weekend, before a stay was issued in an appeals court.

This is in direct contrast to the governor of Michigan, Rick Synder, who has stated that despite the marriages being legal, that he would not be willing to extend marriage rights to same sex couples until an appeals court makes a decision.

Holder's decision comes right on the heels of Synder's statement and seems to directly oppose it.

 

Tags: 
culture
lifestyle
politics
us
  • Read more about U.S. Attorney General at Odds with Governor of Michigan Over Same Sex Marriage
  • Log in to post comments

Sir Richard Branson Says UK Should Not Leave EU

Author: Nufios Staff

Sir Richard Branson, founder and owner of the Virgin Group has said that the UK should not leave the EU.

He has gone so far as to say that leaving the EU would cause Great Britain to become, "Little Britain".

Branson's main point is that leaving the EU would harm UK entrepreneurs and reduce their market.

You can read the article here.

richard branson

Less Than a Week to Sign Up for Obamacare

Author: Nufios Staff

There are only six days left to sign up for the Obamacare exchanges. The White House is pushing a strong campaign dedicated to getting as many members of the public to sign up as possible - especially the 18-34 demographic.

Anyone who does not have health insurance for at least three months out of the year owes the IRS a tax penalty, currently capped at 1% of income.

The deadline to sign up for Obamacare is March 31st, and you can sign up here if you haven't already done so:

https://www.healthcare.gov/

Obama
Obamacare

  • Read more about Less Than a Week to Sign Up for Obamacare

IRS Will Tax Bitcoin Transactions

Author: Nufios Staff

The IRS has now stated formally that Bitcoin will be treated like property, not a currency, and any transaction worth over $600 that is conducted in Bitcoin will be considered taxable.

As stated on CNN Money, "That includes payments made with bitcoins, gains realized by investing in it, and income derived from producing them on your computer, a process known as 'mining.'"

IRS
us
politics
market
forex
currency

  • Log in to post comments

Romney Strikes Back

Author: Nufios Staff

Former Presidential Candidate Mitt Romney blasted President Obama for his flawed view of Putin, and how he handled Russia's annexation of Crimea.

Romney said that Obama did not understand Russia's motivation and intentions, and that the President had failed to shape policy to deal with Russia effectively.

Romney had said on CNN during the 2012 campaign that, “This is without question our No. 1 geopolitical foe. They fight for every cause for the world’s worst actors. The idea that he [Barack Obama] has more flexibility in mind for Russia is very, very troubling indeed.”

Tags: 
mitt romney
barack obama
politics
us
russia
crimea
  • Read more about Romney Strikes Back
  • Log in to post comments

Gay Marriage Ban Struck Down in Michigan

Author: Nufios Staff

A gay marriage ban in Michigan has been struck down after a court ruling.

Judge Bernard Friedman issued an over 30 page ruling on March 21st, 2014 shortly after 5 PM.

Seventeen states currently allow marriage licenses to be issued to gay couples, and several more have had their marriage bans struck down.

gay
